description: Erection of single storey rear extension and two storey side extension
decision_conditions: By reason of its gable roof form, lack of set back from the front elevation and lack of set down from the main roof ridge and proximity to the shared boundary with No. 41 Mayfair Avenue the proposed two storey side extension would appear excessively bulky and dominant in scale and unbalance the symmetry with the roof form of adjoining property No. 37 Mayfair Avenue. As such the proposed development would not relate well to the host dwelling and would result in an incongruous appearance within the streetscene, thereby conflicting with Policies D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy 2012.

Please revise the Validation Checklist with updated information. The new Validation Local List and checklists can be obtained via the council's website: https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applications

The application is made pursuant to Section 96A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended), which concerns non-material amendments to planning permission. Documents and plans considered with this application are:Application formPL01 A - Site Location PlanApplication SiteThe site is located on the corner of Coombe Road (A238) and Station Road, whihc has been recently redeveloped to provied a new school land residential flats  pursuant to plannin gpermission 19/01813/FUL (Variation of Condition 2 (Approved Drawings) of Planning Permission 15/12978/FUL (Demolition of existing office and ancillary building. Erection of part 3 part 6 storey building for 2,478sqm floorspace for a two form entry primary school for a maximum of 420 pupils including provision of double basement for double height sports hall and provision of a raised play deck; and 19 flats (5 no. 1 bedroom flats; 10 no. 2 bedroom units; 4 no. 3 bedroom units). The surrounding area comprises a mixture of residential, student accommodation and retail/ restaurant/ commercial development of varying scale, although the area in the immediate vicinity of the site is characterised by two storey development. There are twostorey cottages opposite the site on Station Road which are locally listed as Buildings of Townscape Merit and there are two storey terraces with shops at ground floor level opposite the site on Coombe Road. The site is not located within a Conservation Area. Norbiton Conservation Area is, however, located to the north of the site beyond the railway line. The site is located a short distance from Norbiton Railway and Public Transport Accessibility Level (PTAL) of 5 (very good). The site is located within Flood Zone 1 (low risk of flooding).This proposal
